intro: Brachystegia nigerica, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its thick, flaky bark and small, elliptical leaves. The tree produces yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the dry season. Its fruits are woody capsules that release winged seeds upon maturity. Brachystegia nigerica is often found in miombo woodlands and plays a significant role in local ecosystems.
